statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

article.headline: Jackson St. 83, Alcorn St. 63
article.story: JACKSON, Miss. -- Grant Maxey scored 30 points to lead Jackson State to a 83-63 victory over Alcorn State on Saturday night. Jackson State (3-12, 2-1 Southwestern Athletic Conference) have won two straight games. Maxey, who scored 13 points in the first half, helped Jackson State outscore Alcorn State 16-4 during a four minute stretch that turned a 19-15 lead into a 36-19 advantage with 3:55 left in the first half. Alcorn State (2-14, 0-3), managed to pulled within 70-62 with 3:59 remaining, but Jackson State responded with an 11-1 run to put the game out of reach. The loss was Alcorn State's eighth straight under first-year head coach Larry Smith. Darrion Griffin added 15 points for Jackson State, which outrebounded Alcorn State 45-31. Anthony Ford led Alcorn State with 18 points, while Troy Jackson scored 17 and Jarvis Williams added 12.
